column2: • Define 3–5 security metrics to track (e.g., open security groups, public S3 buckets, CloudTrail status, IAM MFA compliance) • Create CloudWatch Metrics and Logs groups for these
column3: • CloudFormation or Terraform template for CloudWatch Dashboards and metrics • Boto3 scripts to push custom metrics
column4: Architecture diagram + metric collection code + CloudWatch dashboard view

column2: • Build the Lambda function that collects data and analyzes thresholds • Integrate EventBridge or CloudWatch Alarms to trigger alerts • Configure SNS notifications (email or Slack)
column3: • Lambda (Python/Node.js) code that runs periodically to check metrics • SNS alert workflow • Demo showing alert triggered
column4: Lambda function repo + alert demo screenshots + CloudWatch rule

column2: • Automate daily/weekly summary reports • Store aggregated logs in S3 and generate summary via CloudWatch Insights or Athena • Build final dashboard and slides explaining findings
column3: • Python script that compiles JSON/CSV report and emails via SNS or SES • Final CloudWatch dashboard visuals and slide deck
column4: Summary report JSON + final visuals + slides + metrics table

column2: Collects 3–5 security metrics via boto3 (S3 public bucket check, IAM MFA status, security groups, CloudTrail logging, login failures).
Defines infrastructure – CloudWatch Dashboard, SNS topic, IAM role, S3 bucket for reports.
Main Lambda function: imports metrics_collector, runs periodically, pushes metrics to CloudWatch, and calls alerts/report modules.
Contains SNS alert logic (trigger thresholds → send email or Slack notification).
Generates daily/weekly JSON or CSV summary report from CloudWatch metrics or S3 logs.
Formats and sends summary reports via SNS/SES.
Shared helper functions (for boto3 client creation, logging, error handling).
Visual representation of Lambda workflow and data flow.
Table listing each tracked metric (name, AWS service, threshold, owner).
Final presentation deck (10–12 slides with problem → architecture → demo → metrics).
Step-by-step demo script showing input → Lambda execution → alert → report.
